content.raw: Sounds like we should try to make the minimum overlapping function set large enough for some target use cases. Otherwise we end up with one of two undesirable scenarios, either increased user code complexity (Nate) or a library that's not helpful at all (Emo). Ideally, we should pick 1-3 realistic end-user use cases, and support the entire set of API necessary to perform those particular use cases.
